The second guard gets to his feet and seings his sword -- Indy ducks, slams him in the stomach and dives for the first guard's sword.  He grabs it and rolls aside quickly as the second gaurd attempts to slice him in two! Indy gets to his feet and immediately finds himself about to en- gage in a sword duel with the enraged Thuggee guard.  Indy looks at the unfamiliar sword, hefts it, and tries to quickly decide the best way to use it -- Suddenly the guard shouts and charges.  Indy decides shouting must be the "de rigueur" technique and shouts back loudly -- the two swords CLANG and spark as the duel erupts. Indy flails and feints and the Thuggee guard lunges and slashes. Indy finally gains the upper hand and dispatches the Thuggee guard who slumps defeated into the dirt. Keeping the sword, Indy starts out onto the bridge, walking as quickly as possible across the rickety span.  He hears shouting ahead and looks worried then temple guards appear at the far end of the bridge. The guards suprise Willie and Shorty as they finally get across the bridge.  Struggling   futilely with the guards, Willie shouts at Indiana -- WILLIE Indy -- looks out behind you! Indy sees more Thuggee guards rushing out of the tunnel behind him.  He turns and sees two of the tmeple guards who captured Willie and Short Round coming across the bridge in front of him. Indy stands helpless in the middle of the swaying bridge with guards approaching from both sides, and nothing but heaven above and the rocky gorge hundreds of feet below! A wind comes up and the High Priest, Mola Ram, appears on the far end of the bridge.  He stands with the guards who hold Willie and Short Round. The wind whips around Indy and he staggers unsteadily on the swaying bridge as he watches Mola Ram -- INDIANA Let my friends go! Mola Ram shouts in Hindi and the guards start to move toward Indy from both sides of the bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indiana indicates the bag over his shoulder -- INDIANA You want the stones, let them go and call off your guards! Mola Ram motions and the guards move farther out on both sides of the bridge -- suddenly Indiana swings the sword and it cuts into one of the bottom rope-spans! The rope is half-severed and frays slowly under the tension!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mola Ram motions again the his guards (looking more nervous now) step farther out onto the bridge, mvoing closer to Indy from both sides. Indy swings the sword again, cutting into the other rope-span! It, too, is now partially severed and frays slowly.  The bridge jolts and Indy and the guards sway precariously! Suddenly Mola Ram shoves Short Round out onto the bridge.  The High Priest draws a dagger and pushes Willie onto the swaying span, holding the knife behind them both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In different times this would be called a Mexican stand-off Indiana looks at the guards in front and behind him.  He sees Willie and Short Round out on the bridge now with Mola Ram at their backs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indy and Short Round's eyes meet -- and the kid realizes that his hero isn't kidding.  Willie looks at Shout Round anxiously -- she notices that Shorty is surreptitiously wrapping his foot around a rope support. Petrified, Willie also secretly wraps her foot around a rope and does likewise with her arm -- MOLA RAM Give me the stones!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indiana swings the sword with all his might -- it whooshes through the air and slashes clear through the top and bottom ropes --! Immediately Mola Ram's guards start to flee in panic -- too late! Indiana swings the sword again and the two ropes on the other side are severed -- The rope bridge is sheared in two!  It breaks in the middle and both halves fall apart!  The guards scream horribly in the air as they plunge down into the rocky gorge! Willie and Short Round cling to their established footholds and fall with the bridge toward the wall of the gorge.  Mola Ram spills forward, clutching desperately at the ropes and slats -- Below them, Indiana has latched onto a rope and swings with the bridge as it hits the gorge wall and hangs vertically now, dang- ling from its moorings at the top. There's an instant of suspended animation as all who remain alive realize they are alive.  Short Round and Willie cling near the top of the now vertical bridge. Below them, Mola Ram clutches onto one of the main ropes while directly above him the last of his guards holds on for dear life. Short Round and Willie struggle upwards, clutching ropes and stepping on slats.  Finally, Short Round heaves himself up onto solid ground and turns to help Willie up. Meanwhile, dangling below on the bridge, Indy reaches up and grabs Mola Ram's leg.  The High Priest kicks and tries to break Indy's grip.  He kicks again and smashes Indy in the face. Indy won't let go.  Suddenly the High Priest reaches up and grabs his own Thuggee guard and yanks his down by the front of his shirt -- Mola Ram shoves the luckless guard down onto Indy, trying to dislodge him by sacrificing the screaming Thuggee.  Indy manages to hang on.  The Thuggee is less fortunate and falls screaming to his death. Then Mola Ram looks across the gorge and yells.  Indy sees a dozen of the last Thuggee guards streaming out of the tunnel -- only to be stranded on the far side of the now bridgeless gorge. Indy starts climbing up after Mola Ram again.  He grabs at the back of Mola Ram's robe and pull him down.  Slipping, Mola Ram turns and it's Indy's chance to punch Mola Ram in the face. Mola Ram's eyes are glowing yellow and he's shouting incoherent- ly.  He grabs the strap of Indy's shoulder bag and stamps on In- dy's hand -- Indy falls! Indiana slips downward, scrambling to catch hols of something -- meanwhile, Mola Ram now has the bag with the Sankara Stones. Indy finally stops his downward slide and dangles dangerously near the bottom of the bridge. Across the gorge, the Thuggee guards run up a path to a small gove of trees growing on a plateau above the gorge.  The guards have bows and arrows and take firing positions -- At the top of the bridge, Mola Ram keeps climbing until rocks start poundinghim from above -- Willie and Short Round pely him with rocks which he tries to block with his arm. Indiana starts to climb again, using all his strength.  He reaches for a wooden slat -- suddenly a flaming arrow smashes into the wood! Indy turns in amazement and sees more flaming arrows rocketing across the chasm directy for him! Across the gorge, by the grove of trees, a Thuggee priest yells orders to the archers who continue to launch the flaming arrows. Indiana crawls up as the bridge starts to burn from the continu- ing bursts of fiery arrows.  At the top, Mola Ram reaches up des- perately for a hand old -- Willie smashes his hand with a rock! The High Priest yells in pain and slips down to where Indy slugs him again in the face!  They struggle as the fire burns up from beneath them. On the cliff above the fallen bridge, Willie watches the fire rising toward Indy and Mola Ram as they fight.  Short Round turns and sees something -- SHORT ROUND Willie, look! They see horses galloping through a narrow pass -- the British cavalry is returning.  Captain Blumburtt and the first troops draw up their forses and dismount quickly. A fussilade of flaming arrows force the British to take cover -- they quickly start firing back at the Thuggees with rifles. As the battle above the gorge continues, Indy and Mola Ram fight below on the dangling bridge -- Indiana sees the High Priest's eyes begin glowing and he hisses insanely.  Mola Ram's hand thrusts out toward Indiana's chest and Indy yells in pain -- Indy looks down and writhes terrified as he sees Mola Ram's hand starting to enter his chest (as it entered the victim's chest during the temple sacrifice)! Mola Ram's finger are inching into Indy's body --  Indy clutches at Mola Ram's piercing hand, trying to keep the deadly fingers away from his heart. Slowly, Indy is able to push Mola Ram's hand away and his fingers withdraw from Indy's chest.  Indiana suddenly slugs the High Priest in the face and grabs for the bag of Sankara Stones -- MOLA RAM No, the stones are mine!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Indy pronounces the magical words, the bag begins glowing and starts to burn Mola Ram as he clutches it -- the stones begin to spill out of the bag and the High Priest grabs from them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blazing stones sear Mola Ram's flesh and he screams in pain. The light suddenly dies in his eyes and for one instant he looks at Indy as if awakened from a nightmare -- Mola Ram loses his balance and Indy grabs for the stones.  He manages to clutch only one of them as Mola Ram screams and falls! Indy sees the stone in his hand suddenly cool.  He watches Mola Ram plummeting downward into the chasm and finally crashing into the jagged rocks at the bottom. The irritated crocodiles are disturbed once more -- but soon wel- come the meal that just dropped in.  Jaws flash and teeth rip at the High Priest's likeless corpse. And Indy's bag with the Sankara Stones sinks into the murkly cur- rent and disappears down the river ... 173.   EXT.  THE CLIFF                                                173. Indiana crawls up the burning bridge and Willie and Short Round reach for him at the top.  They pull him up onto the cliff and they all look around exhausted -- Across the gorge, more British troops emerge from the mine tun- nels to subdue the remaining Thuggee guards on that side. Finally the little Maharajah comes out of the dark mine tunnel. He sees Short Round across the gorge -- and bows to thank him for his help.  On the other side, Short Round waves his cap, saluting him back. Willie stands at the edge of the gorge looking down into the riv- er far below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sees Indy reach into his pocket.  He pulls something out slowly -- as she watches he reveals a crystal stone -- INDIANA (Cont'd) The last Sankara Stone. Short Round watches Willie take it carefully from Indiana.  She gazes at it and looks delighted -- WILLIE And the diamond hidden inside... Willie holds the stone up to the sun and it sparkles and flashes
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INDIANA JONES AND THE TEMPLE OF DOOM STORY BY
WILLARD HUYCK AND GLORIA KATZ TM

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Jones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lao She.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nee chin lie how ma?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wah hung how, nee nah?  Wah hwey hung jing chee jah loo nee kao soo wah shu shu.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You never told me you spoke my language, Dr. Jones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't like to show off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For this special occasion, I ordered champagne and caviar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, it is true, Dr. Jones?  you found Nurhachi?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, I found him.  Then last night I had a little trouble. Somebody tried to slit my throat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) It was dark, but I think one of your sons tried to get Nurhachi without paying for him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have insulted my son.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next time I'll cut off more than his finger.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Jones -- I want Nurhachi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As I recall the deal was consid- erably more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Lao) Aren't you going to introduce us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is Willie Scott. (watching Indy) And this is Indiana Jones, the famous archaeologist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Dr. Jones found Nurhachi for me and is about to deliver him -- now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well -- I thought archaeologists were always funny little men searching for their mummies -- (yelping) Aaahhh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) I was only kidding, can't you take a joke -- ? (to Lao) Lao, he's got a knife!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put the gun away, sonny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now I suggest you pay me what you promised -- or your girlfriend here is going to be squealing a new tune.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Try again Lao -- the deal was more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Bingo...you see, Lao, with a but of persuasion, even you can be an honest fellow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look at this!  He put a hole in my dress from Paris!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A bonus, Dr. Jones.  That is poison.  You just drank the rest of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) There is an antidote for this poison.  You give me Nurhachi -- I give you the antidote.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) The poison works fast, Dr. Jones. Where is Nurhachi?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nervously) This Nurhachi's a very small guy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Inside are the remains of Nur- hachi -- the first Emperor of the Manchu Dynasty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Now what about the antidote, Lao.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (holding the box) At last I have the ashes of my sacred ancestor!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, what's the big deal?  Let me see it --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ow, you're hurting me, you miser- able little hood!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let go of her, Lao.  And give me the antidote.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) (smiling at Wu Han) I like the service here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (puzzled) Hey, he's not a waiter...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Wu Han's an old friend I brought along. (to Lao) So, the game's not over. Put the antidote on the table, Lao.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wu Han  --  listen to me  --  I'm going to get you out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be sad, Dr. Jones -- you will soon join him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look out, damn it, I need that antidote!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who cares?  Where's that diamond!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw nuts!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey,doll!  Don't move!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) (shouting to Willie) Hey, don't go away!  I need that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) If I wasn't dying, I'd kill her...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wow!  Holy smoke!  Crash landing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Step on it, Short Round!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okey doke, Indy!  Hold onto your potatoes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Relax, I've been giving him lessons. 8.     EXT.  THE NIGHTCLUB - NIGHT                                    8.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't get your hopes up -- where's the antidote?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't look very good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Poison never agrees with me. (shouting forward) Pull a right, Short Round, and head for the Wang Poo bridge!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Check!  Gotcha!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) There, Shorty!  Through the tunnel!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What're we going to do?!  Where're we going?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The airport...No, look out, Short Round!  Left, left!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting) You got the tickets, Short Round?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, Indy -- three tickets! You, me and Wu Han --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sadly) Wu Han's not coming, Shorty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry, Indy.  Short Round number one bodyguard now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take the extra ticket. (grabbing it from Indy) Where's this plane going anyway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Siam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Siam?  But I'm not dressed for Siam... 12.    EXT. COUNTRY HIGHWAY - NIGHT                                   12.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, they're all right! Let them through please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks, Weber.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Jones, this is positively the last time our airline can hold a plane for you.  Now you must hurry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, what're you supposed to be, a lion tamer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Since I was nice enough to let you tag along, why don't you give your mouth a rest?  Okay, doll?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm freezing.  What do you mean, tag along?  From the minute you walked into that nightclub, you haven't been able to keep your eyes off me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (*subtitled) Dive for the clouds!  Dive! 19.    EXT.  THE SKY - DAY                                            19.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (*subtitled) They hit a fuel line!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (*subtitled*) Reduce speed -- get everyone out of the plane! 21     INT.  THE PASSENGER CABIN                                      21.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lao send planes to kill Indy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wake up!  It's the drug he drank to stop the poison --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got to be kidding!  No!  No, I can't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Wait -- who's flying the plane?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into the radio) Jones!  Indiana Jones!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put it on!  What's wrong with you?  You've got to jump!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, can't leave Indy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me that parachute, I changed my mind --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, this last one!  It's for Indy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (groggily) We there yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's nobody flying the plane! 26.    INT.  THE COCKPIT                                              26.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come here, lady, hold this and shut up please!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I get it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh oh -- big mistake! 28.    INT.  THE COCKPIT                                              28.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you crazy, a lift raft?!  We're not sinking, we're crashing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get over here, damn it!  Short Round, come on, grab onto me tight!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, Shorty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) You all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... I'm not cut out for the kind of life you lead. (moaning) Oh no...I ripped my dress.  Where are we anyway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: India...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Holy cow -- India?  How do you know we're in --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Indiana) What'd he say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He told me they knew I was coming here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean -- how?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The old man saw it in a dream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dream -- nightmare is more like it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He said that's whey they were at river -- they were waiting for the plane to fall down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly to Indy) I hope this means we're going to get some dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) God, I am starving, but I can't eat this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's more food than these people eat in a week. (pointedly) They're starving, too...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, I -- here, please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'd appreciate that.  This was an unexpected detour.  We'll have to go to Delhi now and find a flight west.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Indy is taking me to America.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a professor.  I have to re- turn to the university.  Can you give us a guide to take us to Delhi?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sanju will guide you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: On the way to Delhi, you will stop at Pankot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (puzzled) Pankot isn't on the way to Delhi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will go to palace there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hasn't the Pankot palace been de- serted since the Mutiny of 1857?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (darkly) No. Now there is new Maharajah -- and palace is powerful again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) It is Pankot Palace that kills my village.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand.  What's hap- pened here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The evil starts in Pankot.  Then like monsoon, it moves darkness over all country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What evil?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They came from Palace and took sivalinga from out village.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a sacred stone in a shine that's supposed to protect a village.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is why Krishna brought you here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (politely firm) Nobody brought us here.  Our plane crashed.  We were shot down by -- SHAMAN (interrupting) No.  We pray to Krishna to help us find the stone.  It was Krishna who made you fall from sky -- so you can got to Pankot Palace.  To find siva- linga -- and bring back to us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indy, they make out plane crash? To get you here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's just superstition, Shorty. Like a ghost story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Was the stone very smooth? (he sees the chieftain nod) It was probably brought here from a sacred river.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (joining Indy and the chieftain) Long ago -- before my father's father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And it had three lines painted across it? (seeing the shaman nod) The lines represent the three levels of the universe.  I've seen stones like the one you lost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand how losing one rock could destroy this village. (whispering to Indy) Is it really powerful?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But why would the Maharajah take this sacred stone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They say we must pray to their evil god.  We say we will not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (translating) He says that when the sacred stone was taken the village wells dried up first and then the river stopped.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (translating) He says their crops dies and then the animals died.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Their children?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will find them when you find sivlalinga.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, I don't know how I can help you here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) The English authorities who con- trol this area are the only ones who can help you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They do not listen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have friends in Delhi and I will make sure they investigate this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you will got to Pankot...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What'd he say now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was destined that I came here -- and the future cannot be changed...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sankara... 45.    EXT.  THE VILLAGE - MORNING                                    45.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damn it , Willie, get on -- we've got to move out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whoa!  Easy now -- nice elephant...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nope, you got a little surprise over there, Shorty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Short Round) This is the first time anybody ever cried when I left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They don't cry about you.  They cry about the elephants leaving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Figures...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They got no food to feed them.  So they taking the elephants away to sell them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, let's go.  I want to get to Pankot before tomorrow night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pankot?!  I thought we were going to Delhi!  Hey, wait a minute! (looking at the villagers) Can't somebody take me to Delhi?! I don't want to go to Pankot!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to her elephant) I think you need this more than me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) What're you complaining about, this is expensive stuff!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Indy, look!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those are very big bird.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those aren't birds -- those are giant bats.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They must be pretty dumb to drink that awful-looking water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think maybe we'll camp here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Willie -- I think you better get out now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stark naked?  You wish... If you're trying to seduce me, Dr. Jones, this is a very primitive approach.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me seduce you?  Honey, you're the one who took your clothes off. (shrugging) I just came over to remind you that you never know what else might be in the water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Somehow I feel safer in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry, I'm coming in!  What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A snake!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Hurry, help me out of here! What're you waiting for?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, listen -- Willie -- I got a better idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: First of all -- don't panic!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't let it pull you deeper!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's pulling me deeper!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't let it curl around you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's curling around me!  Damn it, stop talking and do something!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, Willie.  Do exactly what I tell you now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you move your arm?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just one arm!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, I want you to lift your hand -- and pet the snake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, stroke it right along the maxillary and precaudal verte- brae.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pet it on the head!  Go on, pet it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh -- my -- god -- it's going to crush me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep stroking it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) What's happening?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's starting to let go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's good  -- you're doing fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's letting fo.  I think it's -- I think it's going to sleep!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See -- I got you out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks for nothing!  I hate snakes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at the water) I know the feeling...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where'd you find your little body- guard?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I met Short Round when he tried to pick my pocket.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Shorty's family was killed when they bombed Shanghai.  He was living on the streets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) He'll be okay.  He's a good kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) All these fires -- you expecting more snakes, Dr. Jones?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By the way, how'd you end up in Shanghai?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, when my nightclub career was run over by the Depression, some pinhead convinced me that "a girl could go places in the Orient..." So, look where I got.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about the future?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, that's easy -- I'm going to latch onto a good-looking, in- credibly rich prince.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to find one of those myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (raising an eyebrow) Oh really?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, but he's got to be dead and buried for a couple of thousand years. (smiling) Fortune and glory...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that what you're hoping to find at this palace, Dr. Jones?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something that kid gave me last night.  It's a piece of an old manuscript.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) The drawing shows a priest named Sankara who lived centuries ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What does the writing say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's Sanskrit.  It tells the story of Sankara climbing Mt. Kalisa where he met the Hindu god Shiva.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (examining it) That's Shiva?  What's he giving the Priest?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Legend says he told Sankara to go forth and combat evil.  To do that he gave him five sacred stones that had magical powers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at Indy) You mean magical like the rock that was stolen from that village?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It could be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Fortune and glory...sweet dreams, Dr. Jones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think you should sleep closer. (seeing her sus- picious look) I meant for safety.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) I'd be safer sleeping with that snake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Couldn't keep away, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just try and control yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (without looking) Still scared?  Okay, Willie, you can get closer if you want...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Honey, I knew you'd be the first one to give in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indy, look!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's it.  Pankot Palace.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Why are we stopping here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What you look at, Indy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a statue.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the guide talking about? He hasn't said a word the whole trip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's afraid of something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He said he couldn't take us any farther.  He has to go sell the elephants.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean we have to walk the rest of the way?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: shot at, fallen out of a plane, nearly drowned, squashed by a snake, attacked by a bat -- I smell like an elephant! (yelling) I tell you I'm not going to make it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any more complaints?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling faintly) Yeah, I wish you'd thought of this sooner...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It doesn't feel like there's been any permanent damage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello?...(hello?)...(hello?)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (frightened) Hi...(hi)...(hi)...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would say you look rather lost. (disdainfullt) But then I cannot imagine where in the world the three of you would look at home...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling evenly) Lost?  No, we're not lost.  We're on our way to Delhi.  This is Miss Scott -- and Mr. Round.  My name's Indiana Jones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) Dr. Jones?  The eminent archae- ologist?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hard to believe, isn't it...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I remember first hearing your name when I was studying at Oxford.  I Am Chattar Lal, Prime Minister for His Highness the Maharajah of Pankot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Welcome to Pankot Palace. 59.    INT.  PANKOT PALACE - AFTERNOON                                59.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Short Round) How'd you like to run into him in a dark alley...that one's kind of cute...I could see myself married to a prince like that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should have been there...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'd appreciate it if the Mahara- jah would let us stay tonight. We'll be on out way in the morn- ing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am only his humble servant, but the Maharajah usually listens to my advice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) (politely) He's not exactly what we call "a spring chicken".
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, that is Uhmed Singh, the present Maharajah's late father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh -- good.  And maybe the pres- ent Marahajah is a little younger? And thinner?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They will escort you to your rooms now.  You will be provided with fresh clothes.  Tonight you will be dining with His Highness.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dinner?  And with a prince?!  My luck is changing.  But look at me -- my god, I've to to get ready!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look like a princess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's sort of like being in heaven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) I've always had a weakness for folk dancing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (snidely) She might get away with that act here, but she'd never make it in a real nightclub.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are fortunate tonight to have some many unexpected guests.  his is Captain Phillip Blumburtt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Captain Blumburtt and his troops are here to check up on the "natives".
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT (politely) Just a routine inspection tour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The British worry so about their Emprie -- it makes us feel like well-cared-for children.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, Mr. Lal, what do you call the Maharajah's  wife?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: His Highness has not yet taken a wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (happily) No?  Well, I guess he just hasn't met the right woman...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT (joining Indy) Interested in local curios?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  But I am interested in the occult.  And this is a krtya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT (grimacing) Charming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's like the voodoo dolls of West Africa.  The kryta represents your enemy -- and gives you complete power over him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT That God all that mumbo jumbo rubbish is disappearing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think so?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT Of course.  Admittedly, it's taken time.  Britian's controlled India for almost two hundred eyars now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're hanging on better here than you did in America.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT (smiling sourly) This is a different situation, Dr. Jones.  These people are like children.  We have to lead them slowly into the twentieth century.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Prime Minister doesn't seem that naive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT No, he's a very shrewd old boy. Power behind the throne and all that.  He actually runs this whole province.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT I believe we're being called to dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Finally!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe he likes older women.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cheer up, you lost your prince, but dinner's on the way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've never been so hungry in my life...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grimacing) My god, sort of grusome, isn't it...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are honored to be here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Suddenly I'm not so hungry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had a question, Mr. Prime Mini- ster.  I was examining some of the Maharajah's artifacts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A very fine collection of very old pieces, don't you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, very fine.  But not all of the pieces look old.  Some were carved recently and look like images used by the Thuggees to worship the god- des Kali.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Jones, you know very well that the Thuggee cult has been dead for nearly a century.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT Of course.  The Thuggees were an obscenity that worshipped Kali with human sacrifices.  The Brit- ish Army wiped them out about the time of the Mutiny of 1857.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at Willie) But you're not eating!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (weakly) I uh -- had bugs for lunch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I suppose stories of the Thuggees die hard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are no stories anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I don't know... we came here from a small village and the peas- ants there told us that the Pankot Palace was growing powerful again
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: becuase of some ancient evil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sneeringly) Their stories are just fear and folklore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cooly) Maybe.. but how do you explain The Thuggee shrine I saw right below the palace?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT I'm not worried, Prime Minister, just interested.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Short Round) Give me your hat...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to puke in it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know the villagers also claimed that this palace stole something from them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Jones, it our country a guest does not usually insult his host.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, I thought we were just talking about folklore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT (trying to make peace) I'm sure it's nothing.  Just ru- mors. (but interested) What was it they claimed was stolen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something magical.  A sacred rock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (condescendingly) There, you see, Captain.  A rock!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When they lost this rock their fields and animals dies.  They also said their children were taken from them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think that's enough  of this nonsense, Dr. Jones...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So you have something, you know, simple -- like soup or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Looks delicious!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wanna go home...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Chattar Lal) I was dubious muself at first. Then something connected -- the village's rock and the old legend of the Sankara Stones...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (controlling himself) Dr. Jones, we are all vulnerable to vicious rumors.  I seem to re- member that in Honduras you were accused of being a grave robber rather than a scientist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugging) The newspapers exaggerated the incident
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And didn't the Sultan of Madagas- car threaten to cut your head off if you ever returned to his coun- try?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was a misunderstanding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Exactly what we have here, Dr. Jones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have heard the terrible stories of the evil Thuggee cult...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) I thought the stories were told to frighten children.  Later, I learned that the Thuggee cult was once real and did unspeakable things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) I am ashamed of what happened here so many years ago.  We keep these objects -- to remind us that this will never again happen in my kingdom!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a moment) I'm sorry if I've offended you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, dessert!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT Rather bizarre menu, woundn't you say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Even if they were trying to scare us away, a devout Hindu would never touch meat. (looking around) Makes you wonder what these people are...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have seen this thing.  What is it, Dr. Jones?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, nobody touches Indy's whip!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're guests here, Shorty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will show me how it works please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is wonderful!  Please teach me how!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, Short Round, let go of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) The Turks say that a whip can be an enemy even to its owner.  If you get some rope, it'll be easier to learn with, your Highness. Now, I think we'll say goodnight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That little Maharajah think he big stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't like him do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next time I flatten him!  Did you see his eyes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indy, they glow like fire and get real crazy!  Then he talk in this real scary voice!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was afraid of you.  He knows a tough  guy when he sees one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (not so shure) Yeah, that's what happened...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I better see how Willie is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I brought you something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disgusted) Not leftovers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- real food.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, it is real food...it's beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) You're nice.  Listen, I'm taking applications -- how'd you like to be my palace slave?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Wearing your jewels to be, prin- cess?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah -- and nothing else. (smiling) That shock you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking his head) I'm a scientist.  I like doing research on certain "nocturnal activities" --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean like love rituals...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And mating customs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Primitive sexual practices?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're taling to an authority in that area.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want me so bad, why don't you invite me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Too proud to admit you're crazy about me, Dr. Jones?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think you're too used to get- ting you own way, Willie...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (watching him) We'll see who gives in first -- I'll leave my door open.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't catch cold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Jones -- ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're dreaming, Willie.  You want to make it real, just knock on my door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (muttering) ...want me to be her palace slave!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (half asleep) Get to sleep Indy -- I stay up and keep eye on things...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, Shorty ... see you in the morning...I'm going to have a little -- word with Willie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's not coming...I can't be- lieve it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Sleep tight, Dr. Jones! (suddenly melancholy) I could've been your greatest ad- venture... 73.    INT.  INDIANA'S SUITE                                          73.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay, it's over -- go turn off the fan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This a cheap trick to get me over here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get -- the -- bug -- off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gee, I wouldn't want to touch an ugly critter like that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grinning) Uh uh -- me neither!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (studying the bug) You know, Willie, I'll bet he's mad because they were eating his friends for dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please -- oh please, I'm going to die!  Get it off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: *(He reads aloud an inscription in Sanskrit).
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What does it mean, Indy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (translating) "Follow in the footsteps of Shiva.  Do not betray his truth."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: *(He repeats aloud the inscrip- tion also written on the cloth)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Wait a minute!  What're you -- where're you going?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think we suppose to be in here, Indy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) I step on something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're right, there's something all over the floor...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) We'll have to crawl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indy, the floor -- there is some- thing alive!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Holy smoke -- I'm scared, Indy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damn!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey -- where are you?! 77.    INT.  WILLIE'S SUITE                                           77.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Indy -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Willie, come here!  Hurry up, we're in trouble!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Willie, help!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .    INT.  WILLIE'S SUITE                                           81.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm coming, what's the rush?! Ohh!  What's that?!  There's stuff all over the floor!  I can't see a thing! 83.    INT.  THE SPIKE CHAMBER                                        83.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Please, Willie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Willie, open the door!  GET US OUT OF HERE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) A what?! 86.    INT.  THE TUNNEL                                               86.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) A fulcrum release lever!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't find any lever!  Help me Indy! 87.    INT.  THE SPIKE CHAMBER                                        87.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a hole!  I found a square hole!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) That's it -- the release lever -- look inside!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am -- it looks horrible!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Reach inside!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't, Indy!  I can't! 89.    INT.  THE SPIKE TUNNEL                                         89.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Willie! 91.    INT.  THE SPIKE CHAMBER                                        91.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get is off me -- get it off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) You left me out there!  What in the hell were you doing in here?! I want to leave this place right now!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not that one!  We had enought of that one, thank you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a Thuggee ceremony.  They're whorshipping Kali, the goddess of Death and Destruction. 99.    INT.  THE TEMPLE OF DEATH                                      99.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No...the heart's still beating! 101.   INT.  THE ALTAR                                                101.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jai ma Kali, jai ma Kali!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jai ma Kali,  jai ma Kali! 107.   INT.  THE ALTAR                                                107.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quiet! 109.   INT.  THE ALTAR                                                109.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The village knew their rock was magic -- but they didn't know it was one of the lost Sankara Stones...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why they glow like that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Legend says that when the stones are brought together the diamonds inside of them will glow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay -- now listen -- you wait here and keep quiet.  Shorty, keep an eye on her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait -- what're you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Down?  Down there?!  Are you crazy --!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not leaving without those stones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're gonna get killed chasing after your damn fortune and glory!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at her) Maybe...someday. (smiling) Not today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I keep my eye peeled, Indy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh hell, where's he going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What're you -- ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Keep your paws off, letch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Run Willie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) No!  Run!  Go get help!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indy -- you knocked out when you fall.  You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating the kid) This is Nainsukh -- from the vil- lage.  They bring him here to dig in the mines.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Children are small -- we can work in tunnels.  Now I am too old.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What they do to you now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I pray to Shiva -- let me die. But I do not.  Now -- now the evil of Kali take me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They will make me drink blood of Kali.  Then I fall into black sleep of Kali Ma...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I become like them.  I be  alive -- nut like in nightmare.  You drink the blood, you not wake up from nightmare of Kali Ma.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were caught trying to steal the Sankara Stones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shrugging) Nobody's perfect.  The way I heard it, you stole one of them from a small village.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There were five stones in the beginning.  Over the centuries they were dispersed by wars, sold off by thieves like you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two are still missing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  They are here -- somewhere. A century ago when the British raided this temple and butchered my people, a loyal priest his the last two stones down here in the catacombs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what you've got these chil- dren -- these slaves digging for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They dig for the gems to support our cause.  They also search for the last two stones.  Soon we will have all five Sankara Stones and the Thuggees will be all powerful!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody can say you don't have a vivid imagination.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do not believe me?  You will, Dr. Jones.  You will become a true believer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Your Highness will witness the thief's conversion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) I control you now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) You told me that a whip could be an enemy to its owner.  We shall see!  Turn him over!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) As Dr. Jones suggested, I have been practicing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The British in India will be slaughtered.  Then we will over- run the Moslems and force their "Allah" to bow to Kali.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Soon Kali Ma will rule the world!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God, you scared me!  Listen, you've got to help.  We found this tunnel --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We found a tennel that leads to a temple below the palace!  Please, come with me, I'll show you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Miss Scott, you're not making any sense.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid they'll kill them!  We saw horrible things down there -- they had a human sacrifice and they ripped a man's heart out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT Who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's some kind of cult!  And they've got the sacred stones that Indy was searching for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I sense the fumes of opium in all this.  Prehaps Miss Scott picked up the habit in Shanghai.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What're you talking about -- I'm not a dope fiend!  I saw it!  I'll show you! 129.   INT.  WILLIE'S SUITE                                           129.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling faintly) What're we playing, hid and seek?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Indy, you got away!  Tell them what happened, they won't believe me --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They think I'm insane.  Tell them I'm not, Indy.  Please -- help me ...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got to go to sleep now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) I want to go home...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't blame you... this hasn't been what you'd call a fun vaca- tion...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've spent by life crawling around in caves and tunnels -- I shouldn't have let somebody like Willie go in there with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT Miss Scott panicked?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When she saw the insects she passed out cold.  I carried her back to her room.  She was sleeping when I re-entered the tunnel to look around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As she slept, she undoubtedly had nightmares.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then she must have run out of the room and you found her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT Did you discover anything in that tunnel, Dr. Jones?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing.  Just a dead end.  That tunnel's been deserted for years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT Well, Mr. Prime Minister, my re- port will duly note that we found nothing unusual here in Pankot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure that will please the Maharajah, Captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLUMBURTT (to Indiana) As I said before, we'd be happy to escort you to Delhi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks, but I don't think Willie is ready to travel yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indy?  Did you walk to them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So now they believe me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, they believe you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then they'll send the soldiers down into the temple...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) I was scared to death last night when I thought they were going to kill you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... they won't kill me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling faintly) You know you've been nothing but trouble since I hooked up with you -- but I have to admit I'd miss you if I lost you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You won't lose me, Willie...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!  I've found it -- you can't -- Kali knows!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: but I've found -- Kali's touch! Death -- no more lies -- the death I've been searching for! (shouting) Quit crying!  She can hear you -- Kali knows fear -- don't you under- stand -- Kali is freedom!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mola Ram is telling the faithful of out victory.  He says the British have left the palace, which proves Kali Ma's new power.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The pain -- the pain makes him wake up! (thinking quickly) Indy!  I can make Indy wake up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indy! 136.   INT.  THE TEMPLE OF DEATH                                      136.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kali Ma protects us now and for- ever, and we must pledge our devotion by worshipping her with an offering of flesh and blood!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your friend has seen and she has heard -- now she will not talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Indy) This will prove your devotion to Kali.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) No -- no!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wake up!  It's just a nightmare, Indy!  Wake up, please Indy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!  Give him to me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) We got to help Willie!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What're we going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Listen, I'm from the union and I'd like to talk about the working conditions here.  Could you step inside a minute?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What're we going to do?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's got to be another way out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those empty cars have got to go out of the mines.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Come on, let's see if we can catch a ride...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Okay, Shorty -- go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got to get across to the empty cars.  Wait here until I signal you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Come one, what's wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Behind you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I see the problem...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong with him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got one!  Indy, I got one!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indy, look out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please -- pull it out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was the black sleep of Kali...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They made me do evil things... may lord Krishna forgive me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get down here, Shorty!  I got us a ride!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks pal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to try to find the English soldiers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good luck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't appreciate being cooked like a french fry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Willie, come on!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) You do pretty good for a girl!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come here and take the brake!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Slow on the curves or we'll fly off the tracks!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Read you loud and clear, Indy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let up on the brake!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let her go!  Our only chance is outrunning them!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What above the curves?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indy, look out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What're you doing?!  We're going too fast!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get over on the other side!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One down, one to go! 165.   INT.  THE CAVERN ABOVE                                         165.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anymore ideas...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah -- this time you're gonna help! 167.   INT.  THE CAVERN                                               167.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indy!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Grab onto me -- I'm going to try and slow us down from underneath!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ouch...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (frozen in her tracks) Oh... shit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lucky I found a short cut.  Look, there's a light at the end of the tunnel...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some short cut!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing to it -- follow me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) That's far enough!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are in no position to give orders, Dr. Jones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Impressive, Dr. Jones. But I don't believe you would kill yourself!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) Your friends will die with you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then I guess we're all going to take a big dive!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mola Ram -- you're about to meet Kali -- in Hell!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're betrayed Shiva. *(He re- peats in Sanskrit Sankara's warn- ing)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Cont'd) *(He repeats Sankara's warning in Sanskrit)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess Mola Ram got what he wanted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not quite.
dialogue.name: dialogue
